item.title: Drummer of Vengeance
item.description: Drummer of Vengeance is a 1971 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Mario Gariazzo and starring Ty Hardin, Rossano Brazzi and Craig Hill.

item.title: A Long Ride from Hell
item.description: A Long Ride from Hell, in the original Italian known as Vivo per la tua morte, is a 1968 film directed by Camillo Bazzoni. It is based on the novel Judas Gun by Gordon D. Shirreffs. The film was bodybuilder Steve Reeves' final film prior to his retirement. Reeves, who turned down the lead of A Fistful of Dollars financed and co-wrote the film himself upon seeing the successful box office returns of the Clint Eastwood spaghetti westerns at the time. The film did poorly and Reeves retired from filmmaking that year.

item.title: La taglia è tua... l'uomo l'ammazzo io
item.description: The Reward's Yours... The Man's Mine is a 1969 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Edoardo Mulargia.

item.title: Killer Adios
item.description: Killer Adios is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western directed by Primo Zeglio.

item.title: Long Days of Hate
item.description: Long Days of Hate is a 1968 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Gianfranco Baldanello.

item.title: Arizona Colt Returns
item.description: Arizona Colt Returns, also known as Arizona Lets Fly and Kill Everybody and If You Gotta Shoot Someone... Bang! Bang!, is a 1970 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Sergio Martino and starring Anthony Steffen. The feature film debut of Martino after a series of documentary films, it is the sequel of Arizona Colt, with Steffen replacing Giuliano Gemma in the title role and with only Roberto Camardiel reprising his role from the previous film.

item.title: Arizona Colt
item.description: Arizona Colt, also known as The Man from Nowhere, is a Spaghetti Western directed by Michele Lupo and starring Giuliano Gemma, Fernando Sancho and Corinne Marchand.

item.title: Man Called Invincible
item.description: Man Called Invincible is a 1973 Italian spaghetti western-comedy film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Johnny Yuma
item.description: Johnny Yuma (1966) is a spaghetti western starring Mark Damon, Rosalba Neri, and Lawrence Dobkin. The title character earned his name by his exploits in a gunfight in Yuma, Arizona and has no relation to the 1961 The Rebel American television series.

item.title: Zeig mir das Spielzeug des Todes
item.description: Zeig mir das Spielzeug des Todes ist ein Italowestern, der auch unter dem Titel Tag der Vergeltung im deutschsprachigen Raum gezeigt wurde; seine dortige Erstaufführung hatte er am 17. April 1975. Mario Gariazzo inszenierte den Film unter Pseudonym.
